Job Title: Senior Project Manager

Location: Greater Indianapolis

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Overview

When you join American Structurepoint, you gain more than a career. You become part of a family of talented, passionate, good-hearted people who take pride in going the extra mile for our clients. At American Structurepoint, we are known for making the impossible happen for clients across the world who want help building and bettering their communities. We live by our values—excellence, respect, integrity, innovation, and social responsibility. We encourage our experts to try new things and explore new ideas that turn our client’s dreams into reality, even if those ideas are unconventional. We invest in our people by offering excellent benefits and training, development, and mentorship opportunities that lead to a rewarding career path. If you are ready for more than a career, we invite you to explore opportunities to join our team and help us improve the quality of life for the communities we serve.

Group: Architecture 

Position: Project Manager

Location: Indianapolis, IN

Our architects pursue design excellence with a desire to improve the interactions we have with each other and our built environment. We are ranked as the fifth-largest architectural firm in the greater Indianapolis area. Our Architecture Group includes almost 30 distinguished architects, interior designers, planners, graphic designers, and LEED-accredited professionals with direct access to our more than 500 professionals across 11 disciplines. Our collaborative design approach brings to light creative solutions to complex challenges, while balancing social, environmental, and economic realities. We orchestrate the design process with a full range of services, from programming and concept design, through architecture, interior and graphic design, and construction administration services.

Responsibilities

The Project Manager is responsible for overseeing a project team’s communications, financial performance, and ensuring that the work is completed as planned, budgeted, and scheduled. The Project Manager works collaboratively with the Project Architect and Project Designer. Together you are responsible for ensuring that the client’s needs and expectations are properly identified and met. You may manage one or more projects during all phases and direct select staff and consultants to ensure that proper steps and procedures are taken in an effort to ensure project success. This role is collaborative and client focused with a commitment to nurturing the client and project team relationships as well as design excellence.

Leadership

 Foster and maintain a collaborative professional working relationship with Group Leadership  Assist group management in developing and validating project scope and fee, budget, and scope of services during the marketing and contract development process  Assist in preparing project presentations. May participate and/or lead client presentations.  Consistently provide complete and timely communication of project information to and from clients and project team. Responsible for managing project financials and completing work plan including identification of project team members, budget, consultants, schedule for completion, fees and costs as well as project change notices or other actions taking place on the assigned project  Ensures that budgets have been developed to provide for Quality Control Management through the life of the project  Ensure project profitability including the meeting of multiplier goals, work plans and schedule  Foster a culture of client service, both externally and internally 

Marketing and Sales

 Identify new business opportunities while developing current client relationships. Listen for and seek out new projects which may exist or are being formulated  Participate in select marketing and business development opportunities. 

Workflow and Staff Management

 Management of work including coordination of select projects as well as prioritization and scheduling of projects and staff in conjunction with Production Director  Plan, organize and manages projects. Provide on-going communication through team meetings/minutes/up-date memos to project team and group leadership  Communicate with consultants, contractors, sub-consultants and other disciplines to ensure effective project coordination  Monitor construction administration during the construction phase  Develop and maintains positive relationships with consultants and clients  Monthly market area revenue projections with a 3-month and 6-month look ahead  Participate in interviewing of professional staff as needed  Help to manage project AR 

Staff Development

 Continuously monitor project teams. Motivate employees and facilitate open dialogue and feedback  Select staff development including coaching and mentoring, and goal setting in conjunction with group leadership  Performance assessment for select staff including performance reviews in conjunction with Production Director  Help to effectively deal with personnel issues within the group in conjunction with Human Resources and group leadership  Encourage staff exploration and innovation to achieve project design excellence and continual improvement 

Technical Leadership

 Assist with leadership and development of architecture projects  Facilitate coordination between project staff and subconsultants on multi-discipline projects  Large project development and oversight  Aid in project specific, technical problem solving  Facilitate roadblock avoidance and resolution 

Qualifications

 A minimum of 7 years in the Architectural design business (management, engineering, administration) with significant project experience in multidiscipline projects  Ability to effectively work in a team atmosphere and to manage multiple projects of a complex scope.  Strong knowledge of subconsultant services required on building projects including but not limited to MEP, Code consulting, kitchen specialists, acoustics specialists, cost estimators)  Strong knowledge of design, trends, construction methodology, material application, and manufacturer-supplier appropriateness.  Proven project management abilities to ensure on time and on budget delivery along with maximizing profitability  Strong written, verbal and presentation skills with the ability to be articulate and convincing in interviews and other presentations  LEED accreditation strongly encouraged. 

Professional Architectural License with current registration in region(s) preferred.

 Proficiency in Deltek Vision preferred.  Proficiency in Revit preferred. 

Performance Measures:

 Ability to deliver quality service in an effort to create repeat clients  Profitability of projects and control of claims  Management of project AR  Progress of project specific staff development

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
